intro: Karomia macrocalyx f. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth-flowered karomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptic in shape and have a smooth, glabrous surface, giving the species its specific epithet. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
